topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c72326368724f95000085#post_559c72326368724f95000085
I usually watch dubs anyways, I mean unless I immediately realize that the dub is unwatchable then I'll prefer that over the sub

So far the only dubs I haven't liked are the Azumanga Daioh and the PASWG dubs. Other than that, every anime I've watched has either been with a preference to the dub, or watching the sub because no dub existed at the time of watching.
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
Wall Street Journal has accused the Malaysian Prime Minister of transferring US$700M from the state-owned investment fund 1MDB into his personal account.

Right now, I don't know what and who to believe. At one side, we have Wall Street Journal receiving false information sent by someone that probably only heard a rumor. On the other, if proven true, we have a corrupted government who's leader is selfish and had used funds made for the development of the country for his own greed. 

At a third side which probably exists, we also probably have someone in Wall Street Journal that doesn't like the country and tries to sabotage it by undermining the country's economy and political trust.


Basically, it's confusing as hell right now. Wall Street Journal refuses to show evidence of the alleged corruption and criticizes the Prime Minister. The Prime Minister accuses WSJ for showing false information and demands an apology, which they refuse to give.

They're just pulling two end of the rope right now.
